subject: Programming
title: Function Arguments
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Function Arguments.

hook.text: A function with seven arguments is a puzzle. Which value goes where?

buildup.text: The ideal number of function arguments is zero. Then one. Then two. Three is the maximum.

discovery.text: Fewer arguments make functions easier to call, test, and understand at a glance.

twist.text: If you need many arguments, they probably belong together as an object or configuration.

climax.text: Boolean flags as arguments are a red flag. They mean the function does two different things.

quiz.question: Why are boolean flag arguments considered a code smell?
options: They mean the function does two different things
